generations.user_prompt: Derive user stories from the conversation thread, documents, and designs provided in the context.

generated_stories.title: Add a New Todo
generated_stories.description: As a user, I want to add a new todo item to my list so that I can track tasks I need to complete
acceptance_criteria: An input field accepts text for a new todo
A submit button (or Enter key) creates the todo
Empty submissions are rejected (validation)
Input field clears after successful submission
New todo appears in the list immediately
Todo is assigned a unique ID and created timestamp

generated_stories.title: Display Todo List
generated_stories.description: As a user, I want to see all my todos displayed in a list so that I can review what needs to be done
acceptance_criteria: Todos are displayed in reverse chronological order (newest first)
Each todo shows its title text
Completed todos have visual distinction (strikethrough, muted color)
List updates immediately when todos are added, deleted, or modified
Empty state message displays when no todos exist

generated_stories.title: Mark Todo as Complete
generated_stories.description: As a user, I want to mark a todo as complete so that I can track my progress
acceptance_criteria: Clicking a todo checkbox toggles completion state
Keyboard shortcut (Space key on focused todo) also toggles state
Completed todos are visually distinct (strikethrough text, grayed out)
State persists in Local Storage immediately
Completed status affects filter counts

generated_stories.title: Delete a Todo
generated_stories.description: As a user, I want to delete a todo so that I can remove tasks that are no longer relevant
acceptance_criteria: A delete button (trash icon) appears on hover or focus
Clicking delete removes the todo from the list
Deleted todos are removed from Local Storage
No confirmation dialog required for single deletes
List updates immediately

generated_stories.title: Edit Todo Title
generated_stories.description: As a user, I want to edit a todo's text so that I can correct or update task descriptions
acceptance_criteria: Double-clicking a todo title enters edit mode
Text becomes editable in an input field
Pressing Enter saves changes
Pressing Escape cancels editing (reverts text)
Changes persist in Local Storage
Empty edits are rejected
Edit mode has visual indicator (border, background)

generated_stories.title: Filter Todos
generated_stories.description: As a user, I want to filter todos so that I can focus on specific task states
acceptance_criteria: Three filter options: All, Active (incomplete), Completed
Filters are buttons or tabs in the UI
Current filter is visually highlighted
List updates immediately when filter changes
Filter selection persists across page reloads (stored in Local Storage)
Active filter affects the display but doesn't delete todos

generated_stories.title: Display Active Count
generated_stories.description: As a user, I want to see how many active todos I have so that I know how much work remains
acceptance_criteria: A counter displays the number of incomplete todos
Counter updates in real-time when todos are added, deleted, or toggled
Displays singular '1 item left' or plural 'N items left'
Counter is prominently placed in the footer
Correctly reflects the count regardless of current filter

generated_stories.title: Clear Completed Todos
generated_stories.description: As a user, I want to clear all completed todos at once so that I can declutter my list
acceptance_criteria: A 'Clear Completed' button appears in the footer
Button is only visible when completed todos exist
Clicking removes all completed todos from the list
Changes persist in Local Storage
List updates immediately
No confirmation required

generated_stories.title: Data Persistence
generated_stories.description: As a user, I want my todos to be saved so that I don't lose data when I refresh the page
acceptance_criteria: All todos persist in Local Storage
Filter preference persists across reloads
Data is updated in Local Storage on every change (optimistic write)
Page reload displays the exact state from before reload
No backend server is required

generated_stories.title: Responsive Mobile Design
generated_stories.description: As a mobile user, I want the app to work well on my device so that I can manage todos on the go
acceptance_criteria: Mobile-first design with single column layout on small screens
Adequate padding and touch targets (44px minimum height)
Text input and buttons sized for mobile interaction
Horizontal centering of content on larger screens
Max-width constraint on desktop (e.g., 600px)
No horizontal scrolling on mobile

generated_stories.title: PWA Manifest Configuration
generated_stories.description: As a user, I want to install the app on my device so that I can access it like a native app
acceptance_criteria: manifest.json present with name, icons, theme color, and display mode
App icons provided in 192x192 and 512x512 sizes
Display mode set to 'standalone' for app-like experience
Theme color matches app branding
Start URL configured correctly
App is installable on Android and iOS devices

generated_stories.title: Service Worker for Offline Support
generated_stories.description: As a user, I want the app to work offline so that I can manage todos without an internet connection
acceptance_criteria: Service worker implements cache-first strategy
All essential assets (HTML, CSS, JS, manifest, icons) are cached on install
Fetch requests served from cache first, fall back to network
Old cache versions cleaned up on service worker activation
App loads instantly from cache on subsequent visits
App functions fully offline with Local Storage persistence

generated_stories.title: Keyboard Accessibility
generated_stories.description: As a keyboard user, I want to navigate and interact with the app using only my keyboard so that I can use the app without a mouse
acceptance_criteria: All interactive elements are keyboard accessible (Tab navigation)
Enter key submits new todos
Space key toggles completion on focused todo
Escape key cancels edit mode
Enter key saves edits
Focus indicators visible on all interactive elements
Logical tab order through the interface

generated_stories.title: Semantic HTML and ARIA Labels
generated_stories.description: As a screen reader user, I want proper semantic markup and labels so that I can understand and use the app
acceptance_criteria: Semantic HTML elements used (form, ul, li, button, input)
ARIA labels provided on all interactive elements
Form inputs have associated labels
Button purposes are clearly labeled
List structure properly marked up
High contrast colors meet WCAG AA standards
Information not conveyed by color alone

generated_stories.title: SAM Architecture Implementation
generated_stories.description: As a developer, I want the codebase to follow SAM architecture so that state management is predictable and maintainable
acceptance_criteria: Model layer holds authoritative state and enforces business rules
Actions are pure functions that propose state changes
State representation layer handles DOM rendering
Clear data flow: User → Action → Model → State → DOM
State changes trigger appropriate DOM updates
Model persists state to Local Storage after changes
Actions validate input before proposing state changes

generated_stories.title: Vanilla JavaScript Implementation
generated_stories.description: As a developer, I want the app built with vanilla JavaScript so that it has zero external dependencies
acceptance_criteria: No frameworks (React, Vue, Angular, etc.) used
No npm dependencies required
No build tools or transpilation needed
Pure HTML, CSS, and JavaScript only
Code runs directly in the browser
Single index.html, app.js, and styles.css structure

generated_stories.title: Efficient DOM Updates
generated_stories.description: As a user, I want the app to respond instantly to interactions so that it feels fast and responsive
acceptance_criteria: Add, delete, toggle, and edit operations respond immediately
No noticeable lag or jank during interactions
Filter changes are instant
DOM updates minimize reflows and repaints
Only changed elements are updated
Smooth animations on add/delete (optional, fade/slide)

generations.user_prompt: Derive user stories from the conversation thread, documents, and designs provided in the context.

generated_stories.title: Add a New Todo
generated_stories.description: As a user, I want to add a new todo item so that I can track tasks I need to complete
acceptance_criteria: User can enter text into an input field
Pressing Enter or clicking Add button creates a new todo
New todo appears at the bottom of the list
Input field clears after adding
Empty todos cannot be added

generated_stories.title: Display Todo List
generated_stories.description: As a user, I want to see all my todo items so that I can review what needs to be done
acceptance_criteria: All todos are displayed in a list
Each todo shows its title
Completed todos are visually distinguished
List updates immediately when todos change

generated_stories.title: Mark Todo as Complete
generated_stories.description: As a user, I want to mark todos as complete so that I can track my progress
acceptance_criteria: User can click a checkbox to toggle completion status
Completed todos show visual indication (strikethrough)
Status persists across page reloads
Toggling updates the active count

generated_stories.title: Delete a Todo
generated_stories.description: As a user, I want to delete todos so that I can remove items I no longer need
acceptance_criteria: Delete button appears on hover or focus
Clicking delete removes the todo immediately
Deletion updates the active count
No confirmation required for single delete

generated_stories.title: Edit Todo Title
generated_stories.description: As a user, I want to edit todo titles so that I can correct or update task descriptions
acceptance_criteria: Double-clicking a todo enables edit mode
User can modify the text
Pressing Enter saves changes
Pressing Escape cancels editing
Empty edits are not allowed

generated_stories.title: Filter Todos by Status
generated_stories.description: As a user, I want to filter todos by status so that I can focus on specific types of tasks
acceptance_criteria: Filter options: All, Active, Completed
Clicking a filter updates the displayed list
Active filter is visually highlighted
Filter selection persists across reloads
Active count reflects all active todos regardless of filter

generated_stories.title: Display Active Todo Count
generated_stories.description: As a user, I want to see how many active todos I have so that I can gauge my workload
acceptance_criteria: Count displays in footer
Updates immediately when todos are added/deleted/completed
Shows correct pluralization (item/items)
Only counts incomplete todos

generated_stories.title: Clear Completed Todos
generated_stories.description: As a user, I want to remove all completed todos at once so that I can clean up my list efficiently
acceptance_criteria: Clear Completed button visible when completed todos exist
Button hidden when no completed todos
Clicking removes all completed todos
Action is immediate with no confirmation

generated_stories.title: Local Storage Persistence
generated_stories.description: As a user, I want my todos to persist across browser sessions so that I don't lose my data
acceptance_criteria: Todos save to localStorage automatically
Data loads on page refresh
Filter selection persists
Data survives browser restart
Handles localStorage quota errors gracefully

generated_stories.title: Responsive Mobile Design
generated_stories.description: As a mobile user, I want the app to work well on my phone so that I can manage todos on the go
acceptance_criteria: Layout adapts to small screens
Touch targets are appropriately sized (44x44px minimum)
Text remains readable at mobile sizes
No horizontal scrolling required
Works on iOS and Android browsers

generated_stories.title: PWA Manifest Configuration
generated_stories.description: As a user, I want to install the app on my device so that I can access it like a native app
acceptance_criteria: Manifest.json includes app name, icons, theme color
Install prompt appears on supported browsers
App opens in standalone mode when installed
Icons display correctly on home screen
App name shows in task switcher

generated_stories.title: Service Worker for Offline Support
generated_stories.description: As a user, I want the app to work offline so that I can manage todos without internet
acceptance_criteria: Service worker caches app shell
App loads when offline
All core functionality works without network
Updates prompt user when new version available
Cache invalidates appropriately

generated_stories.title: Keyboard Accessibility
generated_stories.description: As a keyboard user, I want to navigate and use all features without a mouse so that the app is accessible
acceptance_criteria: Tab key moves focus through interactive elements
Enter activates buttons and saves edits
Escape cancels editing and closes dialogs
Focus indicators are clearly visible
All functionality accessible via keyboard

generated_stories.title: Semantic HTML and ARIA Labels
generated_stories.description: As a screen reader user, I want proper labels and structure so that I can understand and use the app
acceptance_criteria: Form inputs have associated labels
Buttons have descriptive text or aria-label
List structure uses semantic HTML
Dynamic changes announced to screen readers
Landmark regions properly defined
